    • Field Detail

      • ClaimedHardTotals

        static java.util.Map<JposDevice,java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,HardTotalsProperties>[]> ClaimedHardTotals
        Hashmap containing array of list of claiming device instances per hard total file per HardTotals device. Contains one array per JposDevice instance.
        This map is structured as follows:
        • For each instance of a HardTotals service implemented via JavaPOS-SPF, one array of Map<Integer, HardTotalsProperties> will be put to ClaimedHardTotals, with the service object as key.
        • The dimension of the array will be the number of HardTotals devices the service implementation supports.
        • Every HardTotals instance has a property set with an Index property that specifies which HardTotals device it supports. This is also the index of the corresponding map to be used to claim files.
        • For every claimed file, the property set of the claiming instance will be put into that map, with the file handle as key.
        Therefore, from within an instance of HardTotalsProperties, you can find the property set of a file referenced by a file handle handle as follows:
        Factory.ClaimedHardTotals.get(Device)[Index].get(handle)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Factory

        public Factory()

    • Method Detail

      • addDevice

        public HardTotalsService addDevice(int index,
                                   JposDevice dev)
                            throws jpos.JposException
        Perform basic initialization of given device and property set. Links property set and driver to each other and sets driver specific property defaults.
        Parameters:
        index - HardTotals property set index.
        dev - HardTotals implementation instance derived from JposDevice to be used by the service.
        Returns:
        HardTotalsService object.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If property set could not be retrieved.
